key_points: New York Attorney General Letitia James claims NY's Department of Health underreported COVID-19 nursing home deaths by as much as 50%.
Governor Andrew Cuomo directed nursing homes to accept COVID-19 patients, contributing to high death rates among elderly residents.
Andrew Cuomo made numerous appearances on his brother Chris Cuomo's CNN program, largely avoiding the nursing home death issue.
Critics, including media critic William A. Jacobson, blasted CNN for the conflict of interest and mishandling of the coverage.
When the nursing home controversy was finally addressed on CNN, Gov. Cuomo deflected criticism jokingly.
Journalist Glenn Greenwald and others have harshly criticized CNN for its coverage and handling of the Cuomo brothers' interviews.
Gov. Cuomo blamed the Trump administration for COVID-related issues and defended his nursing home policy.
Gov. Cuomo was previously lauded by the liberal media, authored a book on leadership, and received an Emmy Award.
The attorney general's report suggested that mandated admission of COVID-19 patients into nursing homes may have increased residents' risk.
Media watchdogs and commentators on both sides criticize the coverage and handling of the Cuomo nursing home scandal.
spokespersons: William A. Jacobson (Cornell Law School Professor and Media Critic)
Steve Krakauer (Former CNN digital producer and Media Watchdog)
